title: Top Places to visit in Mandapeta, Andhra Pradesh
content:
Mandapeta, also called Mandavyapuram is a town and an A-grade municipality in East Godavari district in the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is a market place and a place of recreation for many surrounding villages and it is famous for its rice mills.

 

Climate

Mandapeta Mandal receives a cumulative average annual rainfall of 1037.2mm.

 

Geology

Mandapeta is located in the East Godavari Sub-basin of the larger Krishna Godavari Basin.

 

Both Oil and Natural Gas reserves have been found in the Mandapeta formation. ONGC plans to drill wells in the land blocks in Mandapeta to assess the potential of shale.

 

Demographics

As per the 2011 census, the urban agglomeration is home to about 56,063 people. Among them, about 49% are male and about 51% are female, the Population density of the town is 2477 persons per km2. 88% of the whole population are from general category, 11% are from Scheduled castes and 1% are Scheduled Tribes. Child population (aged under 6 years) of Mandapeta municipality is 9% of the total population in which 52% are boys and 48% are girls. There are about 15,000 households in the town.

 

Education

The Primary and Secondary School Education is imparted by Government, Aided and Private schools, There are many reputed schools and colleges in and around the town under the School Education Department of the state. The mediums of instruction followed are English & Telugu.

 

There is a non-residential Government Junior College for both boys & girls. It was established in 1969. The medium of instruction is Telugu. There are many Private Junior Colleges too.

 

Transport

Roadways

Mandapeta is well connected with roads. The road that runs towards Alamuru connects the town at Jonnada with National Highway 16 that runs from Kolkata to Chennai. Buses that depart from Kakinada towards Vijayawada, Hyderabad, Bengaluru and other locations in South Coastal Andhra and Rayalaseema pass through Mandapeta. SH 102 connecting Dwarapudi and Yanam passes through Mandapeta connecting it to Tapeswaram, Draksharama and through Dwarapudi to Rajahmundry via SH 40. The roads connecting Mandapeta to Dulla (connects Rajahmundry), Kapileswarapuram and Jonnada were also among the existing state highways of Andhra Pradesh.

 

Railways

The nearest railway station to Mandapeta is at Dwarapudi which is 8 km away. The nearest major railway station is the Rajahmundry railway station which is 25km away.

 

Waterways

Mandapeta has no operational water transport system nearby. However, Small boats do use the canals and pass through the Tapeswaram Locks nearby occasionally.

 

Airways

The nearest airport to Mandapeta is Rajahmundry Airport which is 30km away.

 

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mandapeta

recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Dhone, Andhra Pradesh
recommendations.content:
Dhone or Dronachalam is a town in Kurnool district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is a Municipality located in Dhone Mandal.

recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Srisailam (RFC) Township, Andhra Pradesh
recommendations.content: Srisailam is a census town in Kurnool district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is the Mandal headquarters of Srisailam Mandal in Kurnool revenue division. recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Krishna, Machilipatnam, Andhra Pradesh
recommendations.content: Krishna district is an administrative district in the Coastal Andhra region of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Anantapur, Andhra Pradesh
recommendations.content: Anantapur (officially:Anantapuramu) is a city in Anantapur district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is the mandal headquarters of Anantapuramu mandal and also the divisional headquarters of Anantapur revenue division. The city is located on National Highway. It was also the headquarters
